website_summaries.verdict: Despite a less-than-perfect connector design, the Black Rapid Sport Slim RS-Sport 2 is a great sling strap for people with more important things to do with their hands when they're not shooting.
pros: The underarm brace on the BlackRapid Sport Slim RS-Sport 2's comfortable and well-designed strap gives it extra stability when you're moving a lot or have a heavy camera
cons: The strap's carabiner attachment is awkward at best and at worst abrades the camera

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the Black Rapid RS-Sport 2 "Slim" Sling Camera Strap with BRAD, ConnectR-2 & FastenR-3
customer_reviews.text: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. The first one broke and my camera and lens came crashing to the sidewalk and needed repaired. Black Rapid did pay for the repair and replaced the strap. After lightly using the second one, the connector pin slipped through the socket and came apart. Black Rapid said their one year warranty does not cover what they called normal wear and tear. Due to two failures, and the company's failure to replace the second broken strap, I cannot recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Photocat

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking standing easy hike. Not climbing or running.
customer_reviews.text: My go to sling and manner to carry. Great to be able to drop the camera and free your hands. Sport, narrower sling still comfortable for several hours with Nikon D600 and 24-70mm. Wider pad better for 70-200 glass. That’s a heavy lens though. You will feel that even in a back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I will have to say I was pretty happy at first. It is very comfortable. And it does rest to the side nicely. The main complaint is the going to be the hook anchor. With 1 weeks use on vacation. The hook and anchor which are coated ,completely started to peel off. They are in constant friction with each other and I worry that one or the other will snap or break, while i am using it and the camera will fall and break.
customer_reviews.author: Tp626

customer_reviews.title: No option for left-handers
customer_reviews.text: Many people already wrote that the BlackRapid strap is overpriced. I completely agree with this statement. On the other hand everybody says that this strap is reliable. So, I consider extra money that I spent as kind of insurance for my rather expensive D90. I spent even more buying Sport-2. A built-in underarm strap is not a must for my activities, but does no harm. I found only one thing that could be done better. I am partially a left-hander and would prefer to keep my camera on the left side, but such an option, perhaps, does not exist. Bottom line: after the first time I used it I will never use the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Abrp722

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful strap! My camera feels incredibly secure at my ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful strap! My camera feels incredibly secure at my hip. The "rapid" comes into play when needing to quickly take a shot. Doesn't take much to lift it to your eye level. I have used my D7200 with a 70-200 f/2.8—approx. 6.25 lbs—lens with the strap and it handled like a champ. I'm 6' 6" and this strap is easily long enough for how I shoot (I usually rest the camera right on top of my hip).
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best camera strap I've come across
customer_reviews.text: Great camera strap that allows your camera's weight to be shifted from the back of your neck (standard in the box straps that come with the camera) to your shoulder. Definitely reduces fatigue, especially when you have a DSLR with a telephoto lens. Also allows the camera to naturally rest along your hip keeping your hands free while walking around. The camera slides easily from your hip up to eye level for quick access to get the shot you need.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a specific purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I saw some one using a similar sling. I was looking for something to replace the dtandard neck strap. After several photo albums, I am a big fan. It takes a while to fit but is very comfortable when fitted correctly. It isnt really suitable for shooting sround the house or in a fixed location. It is ideal for photo outinfs and tourist trips. It is well made and solid. A bit pricey but eorth it ehen you remember it is carrying a thousand dollar camera.
customer_reviews.author: Decessus

customer_reviews.title: that part is not comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: Very well made but I am not crazy about the under arm strap, that part is not comfortable for me. I am 5'3" tall and average build woman. I may still use it though, it is not terribly uncomfortable. I was going to return it after I bought the women's version that has no underarm strap (which I like better), but lost this in the house somewhere and missed the return time. still, it is a good strap to have around for a spare I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Bandit1GreatDog

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy.
customer_reviews.text: The sport2 has a slim fit, not bulky at all. The Brad under the arm is comfortable and easy. The products craftsmanship, design and materials are all high quality. It's 100% more comfortable and all around better than a neck strap. The biggest negative going from hand shooting to tripod shooting, that can be inconvenient. The product uses/blocks the tripod hole on the camera so you have to take the sling off to use a tripod. Unless you have a place on your actual lens to attach your rapid fire, which most do not. Still if your leaving the tripod at home for the day the rapid RS-Sport2 is a very nice option.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It might be good enough for you if you only shoot from the ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work for me. It might be good enough for you if you only shoot from the eye level. However, it doesn't let you shoot from any other positions - you feel like you are on a leash...
customer_reviews.author: AboveClouds

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable camera strap you will ever own.
customer_reviews.text: I had the first version of the RS-Sport and absolutely loved it. When we purchased a second camera I came to Amazon looking for another and discovered the RS-Sport 2 version. The shoulder pad is just a little bit narrower and the overall length is just a little bit shorter. I'm 5'9" and 220 and this fits me just fine. My wife is 5'11" with boobs and it fits her just fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sling.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research into what I wanted. I was going to go to the cheaper strap, but had a friend buy one and the camera connector broke and his camera hit the floor. This thing is great. Holds your camera snug and you don't have to worry. As soon as you pick this thing up you will see the quality. I have a Dolica GX600B200 Proline GX Series tripod with a quick release plate. I bought the upgraded fastener and had a little drilling to do, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Pray

customer_reviews.title: Solid strap, but not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and all, but having a camera bouncing into your hip takes some getting used to. It does beat having a camera dangling in front of you from your neck though.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: It works so much better than carrying the regular camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a month long trip to Thailand. It works so much better than carrying the regular camera strap.
customer_reviews.author: C. West

customer_reviews.title: A must have...
customer_reviews.text: A must have. This strap is great. It does take the weight of the camera off of your shoulders. The improvement of having an under arm strap makes the product complete. The underarm strap stablizes the strap keeping the strap from moving around. Each part of the strap feels like it is made well. The only con that I have about the strap is the price. I think it would be better priced at $50.
customer_reviews.author: mike8o8

customer_reviews.title: years later and i still love this strap
customer_reviews.text: years later and i still love this strap... i should have never wasted money on the knock off's and went straight for the black rapid!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Black Rapid RS-Sport 2
customer_reviews.text: Good product. This is my first custom strap, so can't really compare to other products. I am overall happy with the productions. There are probably a few improvements that can be done to the product such as how the under arm straps are designed or located (especially fell kind of weird if you are wearing a sleeveless. overall, happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Spacekid

customer_reviews.title: The Sling Camera Strap!  What would I do without you!
customer_reviews.text: Buying this on my friend's recommendation was the best decision I've made for my camera. It is much more convenient than a conventional strap, and I find my desire to bring my camera with me to have increased a lot. One note though, I don't think you need the BRAD strap for cityscape walk around stuff. Maybe if you are hiking all day or going somewhere with a lot of movement. I honestly don't use mine, and have taken it off.
customer_reviews.author: LightTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the clamps and clips on this strap
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the clamps and clips on this strap, they all feel extremely cheap. The strap running across the back has a couple of clips that land right in the middle of your back and are extremely aggravating. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: TCInd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent system
customer_reviews.text: Beats the traditional straps that come with the camera hands down....not sure why I found this option so late in the game but glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: MB in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for and it works so well. Beats the heck out of having the camera hanging from the neck all day. It also prevents things from sliding around and is extra insurance that the strap is secure on my shoulder. A bit on the expensive side but all a person has to do is drop a $6K camera and lens once to realize it is really worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for my camera I've made to date! I'm an avid hiker and I got sick of lugging my camera around hanging from my neck, but this had made hiking with my SLR so much easier. I always have my camera on the ready now. I not only use this for hiking, but just walking around on photo walks or just every day tasks. Definitely worth the buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Howells

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!! Your shoulder will love you
customer_reviews.text: Camera strap design takes a load off your neck and shoulder. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Diebold

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: If the camera is out with me on a shoot, while on holiday, or the amusement park, this is always attached. It fits nicely and I feel secure with it on me and the camera. I would definitely recommend this product to any photographer. I really like the stop built into the strap to keep the camera from swinging to far back when it slides back down to the resting position.
customer_reviews.author: Frans van Ellekom

customer_reviews.title: can't live without it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that is so important, and so good, that I can get over the fact that it is so expensive for what it is. You are paying for engineering and innovation more than actual cost of materials and manufacturing. The fact is that I can't imagine photography without an R-Strap.
customer_reviews.author: thekingb

customer_reviews.title: The camera was easy to swing up so I could take a shot
customer_reviews.text: When I used this last week for three days, my camera always stayed in place at my side, even when I stooped over. The camera was easy to swing up so I could take a shot.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: They have protected the camera strap!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Semi pro photographer. I bought the sun sniper and enjoyed it for years but the black rapid protected the camera strap. Light weight. Best part is the little strap that goes under your arm locking it into place. So you camera is always right there by your side.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I wore my camera around my neck
customer_reviews.text: I hike with a 300mm zoom on my DSLR, and this strap makes it effortless. It's super quick when you see something you want to shoot, and it's easy to secure the camera behind your back when you're on difficult terrain and you don't want it swinging around.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Pure genius!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Black Rapid today. How have I not found this thing before??? Pure genius!! I have walked all over numerous places in Europe, Alaska, and Central America with a standard neck strap tied around my wrist. And thinking I was doing well! LOL! And I put it on along with my mid-sized backpackers backpack as well and they will work just fine together, so I'm all set for the Inca Trail in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner John in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Works well for my DSLR w/ 70-200mm ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Works well for my DSLR w/ 70-200mm lens. Handles the weight comfortably and the camera's always at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Tremper

customer_reviews.title: Like Strap, but had to return as it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Like Strap, but had to return as it was a Slim. I have since purchased the same strap in a standard form and it works Great. Use a tether kit for safety backup if you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a family member and they love it. States it is much better than the regular neck strap which gets tiring after a few hours
customer_reviews.author: Hamlet

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love? Don't hesitate to buy one of these
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? Don't hesitate to buy one of these, they are very well made. I also like that they market to Japanese speakers on their packaging. It's a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Nomura

customer_reviews.title: Good Strap
customer_reviews.text: Love the strap, hate that I bought the slim version. I am 235 pounds with a muscular build and the strap is extra tight. However, I let my partner use it who is much smaller and it works fantastic. I did end up buying the regular version and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Sling Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Rapid-Sport 2 Camera Strap for my nephew who wanted it to take on a school trip. He likes it because it puts the weight of his camera on his shoulder and not on his neck. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: H.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great strap.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So much more comfortable! Need to purchase additional screw pieces for each lens and one for the camera body. Also need a separate "leash so when changing out bigger lens, the body is attached to something. Feels unsafe not having the body attached to something at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Paul K

customer_reviews.title: A great strap that just plain works
customer_reviews.text: A great strap that just plain works. Makes using a camera much easier, gives a sense of security, and doesn't make you look like a tourist with a neckstrap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to contradict myself here. The product works as advertised and I really like it. It works as advertised. I would probably buy it again but in no way is it worth $80 (including shipping). Looking at it I think it is worth about $25 max. But it does work!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a neck strap!
customer_reviews.text: Makes carrying a heavy DSLR and lens comfortably all day for wedding photoshoots (for example) much easier. I never shoot anywhere without it.
customer_reviews.author: Andygo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable once adjusted just right
customer_reviews.text: This strap takes a little getting used to but will save your neck over the course of a long day of shooting! Very comfortable once adjusted just right!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Combs

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomend
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the camera secure and out of the way but ready at a moments notice. Easy to use, and very adjustable for different users. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Redfern

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This strap is great. I use a canon 60D with the 18-200 lens. Its exactly what I expected and very comfortable to wear all day. I am really happy with this product. The pad is not too thick and the underarm strap can be removed easily. It is easy to adjust, and stays in place well. You can reverse it to the other shoulder, but it doesn't work as well. Definitely designed to hang on the left shoulder and have the camera at your right hip.
customer_reviews.author: haaky

customer_reviews.title: Great Strap
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Much less tiring carrying my D800 with a heavy lens on it. I did have to learn how to put the darn thing on, but that's probably just me.
customer_reviews.author: William HallTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't built for a womens body so switched it out for the Womens Sling
customer_reviews.author: Gwen H

customer_reviews.title: used this strap during two recent vacations and it's perfect. I was able to carry my Nikon D750 ...
customer_reviews.text: used this strap during two recent vacations and it's perfect. I was able to carry my Nikon D750 with a heavy 28 - 300 lens with no fatigue. One of the best accessories i have purchased for my DSLR
customer_reviews.author: Howard McBean

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and plain easy to use! Tried on a day hike and works wonderfully! Wonder how I did without it before. Quite expensive (reason for 4 stars) but at least quality is there. And the experiences that you get from using it can't be described! Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Khao

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the strap, but it was shipped with an off brand attachment, not the Black Rapid FastenR-3
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a go around strap and I am loving it each time it saves me time. Just pull the camera and shoot. Exceptional quality for which BR is known for.
customer_reviews.author: Senhorpedro

customer_reviews.title: I have the rs7 and this its better, more confutable and
customer_reviews.text: A must have, I have the rs7 and this its better, more confutable and secure
customer_reviews.author: Leonel

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The strap arrived on time and as described. This is a must have for any DSLR user that carries the camera around for any length of time!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy W.

customer_reviews.title: Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: I carry my Nikon D610 (heavy DSLR) with this strap and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel DeGennaro

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: As an American living in Europe, I bring my camera everywhere. I recently went to Valencia for a week and found it comfortable and easy to use. I'm 5'8" and had to have it let all the way out to a position I was comfortable with. Not sure how a taller person would find it.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of equipment for mobile photographers. Camera position can be adjusted along the strap and then locked in place. Made carrying my camera very comfortable and trouble-free.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lauriano

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like this strap, it's so much better than a neck strap but it's not very appropriate for a very heavy price of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Niyaso Cannizzaro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: one of the best camera straps I've ever used! Thanks for the invention!
customer_reviews.author: Lsanz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for street photography
customer_reviews.text: A good innovation, but I hope they come up with a way to make it easier to walk with, especially when going for street shooting. The camera tends to bound on your body as it hangs. This might be petty bitching, but it's not worth $70. Maybe for half that.
customer_reviews.author: Framooze Akhi

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for any one interested in advancing their photography. Easy to use and packs away neatly each time used.
customer_reviews.author: Midge E. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Don't use it as much as I though I would.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I love this strap.
customer_reviews.text: This is a much easier on your neck strap than the one that comes with the camera. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Does not include the Lock Star Connect
customer_reviews.text: Strap is great! Although, photos could be misleading to think that the lock star is included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I really like it - I can carry the camera all day. The strap is very comfortable and it feels secure.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cyzio

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my neck
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my neck. it supports very well a canon eos 7d with grip and 2 batt and 28-135 ef zoom , witout any stress to the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Victor V.

customer_reviews.title: It Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and keeps camera ready when not in ue. It's comfortable. I'm 6'4". Only negative is that it would have been better if I could adjust it to be a few inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Greenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Saw this on Froknows.com and decided to get one. Because I have big trapezoids, it tends to slip down my shoulders. Other than that....highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: This thing rules. period.
customer_reviews.text: It's easily the best camera strap that I've ever used. Some people were complaining about the camera "spinning" while being locked down at their sides... I've not experienced that, my rig stays perfectly in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Hauser Digital

customer_reviews.title: This is SO AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate; this is the greatest camera strap ever invented. I just put mine on, and even with a couple of hours of use, I can say without reservation, JUST BUY IT! I'll have to watch for the flaking of the chrome, but even then, it will so a "so what". It is so comfortable, convenient, handy, well made, that I wish I hadn't waited so long to get one. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Henricks

customer_reviews.title: Good Chioce...won't regret
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable fitted with my 5D Mark II + 70-200 2.8L IS II on. So neat, high quality material, durable, suitable for all in and outdoor event. The under-arm strap can be taken off for just carry about and around town, but for event that need to strap everything securely in place, put the strap on and the job is done.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: i have the canon 5d mark iii, and the ...
customer_reviews.text: i have the canon 5d mark iii, and the canon 70-200 f2.8 is ii. both weight a lot they're very heavy. guess what? with this strap i barely feel them.
customer_reviews.author: bandar alhazmi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best addition to my camera. You won't regret it. JUST BUY IT! It is so comfortable, convenient, handy, well made. No neck pain.This is the perfect product for anyone who walks around with their DSLR for any length of time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skinny strap makes the camera feel heavy
customer_reviews.text: Too skinny on the shoulder, makes the camera feel heavy. Got the regular full-sized RS as a replacement which makes the camera fit a lot better. Strap is also perhaps an inch too short for me (I'm 6'4" though so it might work for you if you are shorter).
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Merrington

customer_reviews.title: MUST buy
customer_reviews.text: i have no idea how i used to take photos n the streets and in jungles without this ,, i love it must have
customer_reviews.author: xemega

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying heavier cameras
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very comfortable to wear. It secures the camera safely and the camera is ready to use instantly. I would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lipchen

customer_reviews.title: I love this strap
customer_reviews.text: After buying and using this strap on my dslr, my wife is demanding I buy one for her camera. I will never go back to a neck strap. I love this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Wightman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its awesome and love the flexibility and how the weight of the camera is spread across the shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Saravanan Susairaj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and holds the camera out of the way perfectly, but ready for quick use. Easy to use right out of the box, I am excited to use it in the field.
customer_reviews.author: D MacIsaac

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent product easy to use and plenty of room for adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: William Fung

product_meta.title: Black Rapid RS-Sport 2 "Slim" Sling Camera Strap with BRAD, ConnectR-2 & FastenR-3
product_meta.description: Black Rapid RS-Sport 2 "Slim" Sling Camera Strap with BRAD, ConnectR-2 & FastenR-3 OPEN BOX
feature_bullets: The RS-Sport-2 will keep your gear safe and steady, even in the most strenuous situations
Slide your camera up the strap to grab the perfect shot
With it's sturdy design and under-arm safety tether, the RS-Sport-2 isn't going anywhere, even if you are.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars270 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
